Description.Name: Victory
Description.Details:
<color=#BFBFBF>The mess hall is louder than it’s been in weeks—laughter, clinking cups, exhausted sighs of relief. Victory buzzes in the air like static. The hulking war machine is gone. Against all odds, they won.

Sumire leans back in her chair, grinning.</color> “Still can't believe we dropped that walking mountain. Bet the whole damn planet felt it hit the ground.”

<color=#BFBFBF>Yang scoffs through a mouthful of food.</color> “I felt it in my spine. Thing must’ve weighed more than an assault carrier.”

<color=#BFBFBF>Even Farah allows herself a tired smile.</color> “And now… maybe this ends.”

<color=#BFBFBF>But as the minutes tick by, the smiles begin to fade. No encrypted burst from Arelle. No update. No acknowledgment. Nothing.

Darius glances around the table, frowning.</color> “She should’ve said something by now. Even a one-line message.”

<color=#BFBFBF>Farah checks her terminal again.</color> “No ping on her key. Nothing from the [[DM.Factions[faction_GhostBearWatch],Watch]] core either.”

<color=#BFBFBF>Yang mutters,</color> “Maybe she’s off the grid now that her job’s done. Pulled a vanishing act.”

<color=#BFBFBF>Sumire’s expression darkens.</color> “But the [[DM.Factions[faction_MinnesotaTribe],Tribe]]’s not done. They still hold systems. Why disappear now?”

<color=#BFBFBF>Suddenly an incoming transmission flashes on the main wall.</color>

<color=#DFDFDF>INCOMING: Ghost Bear Watch Command priority signal – Level Three Encryption Detected – No personal authorization key present.</color>

<color=#BFBFBF>Darius straightens instantly.</color> “That’s not right.”

<color=#BFBFBF>The room stills.</color>

Description.Name: Head to the Conference Room straight away
Head to the Conference Room straight away
Description.Details:
<color=#BFBFBF>The crew files into the conference room, tension mounting with each step. The lights dim as the encrypted transmission waits silently on the main screen—unclaimed, unfamiliar, and wrong. Darius mutters something under his breath as you step forward and reach for the terminal controls.

No one speaks. No one breathes.

Whatever’s coming next, it might not be good. Not good at all.</color>
